Metadata.Title: [1612Dupe] Validate and Encode Data Inserted into XML Documents
Metadata.DirectLink: Validate and Encode Data Inserted into XML Documents

Content.Data:
==Applies To==
* iOS applications that handle XML documents.
==What to Do==
Validate and encode data inserted into XML documents.
==Why==
Validating and encoding data inserted into XML documents helps prevent XML injection vulnerabilities.
==How==
To validate and encode data inserted into XML documents:
# **Identify XML documents used by the application.** Examine the application design to identify all XML documents and XML document types used by the application. # **Identify code that handles XML documents.** Find all application code that handles XML documents. # **Write data validation methods.** Write methods that validate all the data types that are stored in XML documents and used by the application. # **Use validation code.** Call the data validation methods from the previous step wherever the application handles XML documents. Validation should be performed before encoding. # **Write encoding methods.** Write methods that escape XML entities. Unfortunately, there are no stable libraries available for escaping XML entities for iOS. When writing code that escapes XML entities, consider the following: #* Data must first be converted to a uniform character encoding. #* XML entities must be escaped properly. #* Code that loads XML documents should be able to restore the original data from the encoded data. # **Use encoding methods.** Call the encoding methods wherever the application handles XML documents.
